content.text: Adonai , remember David [Beloved] and all his affliction,
how he swore to Adonai ,
and vowed to the 'Avir Ya'akov [Mighty One of Supplanter]:
“Surely I will not come into the structure of my house,
nor go up into my bed;
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
or slumber to my eyelids;
until I find out a place for Adonai,
a dwelling for the 'Avir Ya'akov [Mighty One of Supplanter].”
Behold, we sh'ma ·heard obeyed· of it in Ephrathah.
We found it in the field of Jaar:
“We will go into his dwelling place.
We will hawa ·bow low, prostrate· to worship at his footstool.
Arise, Adonai , into your resting place;
you, and the ark of your strength.
Let your priest be clothed with righteousness.
Let your saints shout for joy!”
For your servant David [Beloved]’s sake,
don’t turn away the face of your anointed one.
Adonai has sworn to David [Beloved] in truth.
He will not turn from it:
“I will set the fruit of your body on your throne.
If your children will keep my covenant ·binding contract between two or more parties·,
my testimony that I will teach them,
their children
also will sit on your throne forever more.”
For Adonai has chosen Zion [Mountain ridge, Marking].
He has desired it for his habitation.
“This is my resting place forever.
Here I will live, for I have desired it.
I will abundantly bless her provision.
I will satisfy her poor with bread.
Her priests I will also clothe with yesha' ·salvation·.
Her saints will shout aloud for joy.
There I will make the horn of David [Beloved] to bud.
I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but on himself, his crown will be resplendent.”

footnotes.text: MP: Messiah is the sprout from David’s line. (Combined with Is 11:1). (Luke 1:68-70)
